title: Drawing, "Window case and half of a figure of a Turk", 1750–70
medium: Graphite, pen and sepia ink, brush and gray watercolor on paper
markings: watermark: similar to upper part of Churchill 405
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Large bearded man with feathered hat seated on a balcony before and curtained, open portal. The upper entablature is circularly curved. In the upper part of the window opening are window curtains. The Turk is sitting and leaning his left forearm upon the parapet. He wears a cap with a feather. The moldings forming the lower part of the window frame are drawing to the lateral edges.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Window case and half of a figure of a Turk", 1750–70. Graphite, pen and sepia ink, brush and gray watercolor on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2420.
